status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"103pe","text":"Passivate flow cell with   BSA in imaging buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5t6eo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"E75AB340CA9D11EC812967A3C632E5EA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":204}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8mb69","text":"Rinse flow cell with 2 flow cell volumes of imaging buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"mbas","text":"Mix GUVs with fluorescent protein and add to flow cell, allowing GUVs to settle on the bottom surface of the flow cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6cc8q","text":"Add   of a 1:1000 dilution of silica beads to flow cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"25u3h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"035469B0CA9E11EC812967A3C632E5EA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e1gqv","text":"Trap a bead in the optical trap, bring into contact with a GUV, and retract, forming a membrane tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2rgv","text":"Visualize protein recruitment to membrane tube with confocal microscopy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Membrane Tube Assay
